title: Authentic Chicken Biryani Recipe – Step-by-Step Guide for Restaurant-Style Taste | Cyberdine
content:
Learn how to make mouth-watering, restaurant-style chicken biryani at home. Follow this step-by-step guide with tips from Cyberdine (https://www.cyberdine.in/) to cook the perfect biryani with rich flavors and aroma.

Introduction
Chicken biryani isn’t just food—it’s an experience. This aromatic, flavorful rice and chicken dish has won hearts all over the world. Today, we’ll share a restaurant-style chicken biryani recipe that you can cook right at home. Plus, we’ll talk about Cyberdine—a trusted platform for premium restaurant technology solutions. Ingredients (Serves 4–5)

For Chicken Marinade:
500g chicken (bone-in pieces)
1 cup thick yogurt (curd)
2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
2 tsp red chili powder
1 tsp turmeric powder
2 tsp biryani masala powder
1 tbsp lemon juice
Salt to taste

For Rice:
2 cups basmati rice (soaked for 30 min)
4 cups water
2–3 cloves
2 green cardamoms
1 bay leaf
1 cinnamon stick
Salt to taste

Other:
3 medium onions (thinly sliced)
2 medium tomatoes (chopped)
3–4 green chilies (slit)
½ cup mint leaves
½ cup coriander leaves
4 tbsp ghee (clarified butter)
2 tbsp cooking oil
Saffron strands soaked in ¼ cup warm milk (optional)

Preparation Steps
Step 1 – Marinate the Chicken
In a large bowl, mix all the marinade ingredients. Add the chicken and coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (or overnight for deeper flavor).

Step 2 – Cook the Rice
Boil water with whole spices and salt. Add soaked basmati rice and cook until 70% done. Drain and set aside.

Step 3 – Fry the Onions
Heat oil and ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot. Fry sliced onions until golden brown and crispy. Remove half for garnishing.

Step 4 – Prepare the Chicken Base
In the same pot, add green chilies and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes soften. Add marinated chicken and cook on medium flame until 80% cooked.

Step 5 – Layering the Biryani
Lower the flame.
Spread half of the cooked rice over the chicken.
Sprinkle mint, coriander, fried onions, and saffron milk.
Add the remaining rice and repeat toppings.

Step 6 – Dum Cooking
Cover the pot tightly (seal with dough if possible). Cook on low heat for 20–25 minutes to allow flavors to blend.

Serving Suggestions
Serve hot with raita, salad, or boiled eggs. For a restaurant-style touch, garnish with fried onions and fresh mint leaves.
